column4: Can anyone help me, Im trying to set up a "Sandisk 4gb Cruzer Micro" flash drive, onto linux & I will wish to use it for windows also. Here is the output of http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/37354/ . I basically just need some help setting it up.
Output of dmesg*
format it as FAT for use with both linux and windows
how would I go about doing that?
do you have gparted installed?
ok, open gparted up
is the drive plugged in?
make sure you click refresh devices in gparted
can you pastebin the output from dmesg | tail for me after plugging the drive in
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/37358/
ok, looks like ubuntu has found it as /dev/sda
sure - im just looking at the correct command
try this: mkdosfs -F 32 -v /dev/sdc
wait - no
run fdisk /dev/sda
why "mkdosfs -F 32 -v /dev/sdc" and not "mkdosfs -F 32 -v /dev/sda" ?
because I got it wrong :) use sda for all commands - sorry
i think it needs a partition to format as fat - try sudo fdisk /dev/sda
hmm
did you run fdisk with sudo?
do u have a windows machine around btw?
yes
(yes to both of those)
if you have a windows machine it may be easier to plug it in, right click it in my comp and select format.
